Welcome to EmploymentFirstMA.org! This site supports the implementation of the Blueprint for Success: Employing Individuals with Intellectual Disabilities in Massachusetts.



Subscribe to Our E-Newsletter

Newsletter archive.

Supporting Workers with Developmental Disabilities: The Employment Specialist Perspective

The partnership between employment specialists and job seekers/employees with developmental disabilities is at the core of quality employment services. This month, Jill Eastman, the employment services program coordinator at the Institute for Community Inclusion, explains the employment specialist/job seeker relationship.

Read more and listen to the recording here


Check out our latest publication, Ensuring Excellence in Community-Based Day Supports: A Guide for Service Provider and Staff. Written by ICIâ€™s David Hoff and consultants Cori Di Biase and Genni Sasnett, this tool is a great resource for providers seeking to develop or enhance their CBDS program.

Personal Stories

Rosanna

 

Rosanna sorts and delivers mail at the Merrimack Valley Credit Union in Lawrence, MA.

Frank

 

Frank is a lot attendant at the Home Depot in Somerville, MA.

Maggie

 

Maggie works at a marketing and advertising agency in Boston, MA.

Promising Practices

    Work Inc.: Using Strategic Planning to Support Transformation
    Academic and Vocational Opportunities for Transition-Age Youth: New England Business Associates
    Making Community Connections for Transition-Age Youth: Melrose Rotary Club, Melrose, MA
    Partnering with Schools to Serve Transition-Age Youth: Berkshire County Arc, Pittsfield, MA
    Multiple Options for Transition from School to Work: Community Enterprises, Holyoke, MA
    Community-Based Instruction for Transition-Age Youth: King Philip Regional High School, Wrentham, MA

EmploymentFirst is presented by the Institute for Community Inclusion at the University of Massachusetts Boston and is funded by the Massachusetts Department of Developmental Services.
